Last night, around this time, I received an email from Australian immigration granting me a 12 month working holiday visa. So sometime soon I'll be heading off. I guess this is going to be a diary of it all. It seems like a good time to be starting it. As it stands at the moment I am working in Glasgow, saving money to head out to Sydney. Waiting there is a nice guy called Keith. Well, he's not just waiting there. He's doing other things too, like working in investment banking and playing tennis and inviting friends round for jacuzzis. Actually right now he is in Seoul which is in Korea fact fans! I think there may have been a world cup there when I was younger. I think I may have built the mascot for it out of a kinder egg. I wonder how it will all pan out? Will I: a) be struck down tomorrow on the great western road by a 'wee happy bus'? b) hear that Keith has been struck down in the streets of Korea by a 'wee happy rickshaw'? c) get to Sydney and be struck down with heat exhaustion and sent home in a fridge? All will be revealed... Jono x ps - this blog is called Knees of My Bees. It comes from a joke on 'Kath and Kim' - a v amusing aussie sitcom that you can sometimes catch on LivingTV. Its also the title of a song on Alanis Morissette's new album 'So Called Chaos' which is a very good album.

hey folks. I'm just back from a trip to Oban on the west coast of Scotland. Was doing a spot of filming there but it wasn't the greatest of shoots for me. It all started when we turned up at the hotel to find it was pretty minging and the owner had a go at us because apparently the BBC still hadn't paid its bill from last time some crew stayed there. (Who were these BBC employees and why didn't they warn us?). Anyway the rooms were vaguely ok but the bar was really dark and it had a huge carved wooden penis on the bartop with two wee ashtrays where the testicles should be. I wanted to get a picture of it but it was behind a few bottles and i didn't want to touch it in case it was used in whatever wicker man activities they get up to up there. Anyway that still wasn't so bad until I ordered my coke. The people we were filming had arrived and we were to have a bar lunch with them and generally schmooze and impress etc. I took a swig of my coke and felt something in my mouth. I thought it was like a bit of lettuce or something. I reached into my mouth and pulled out...... the biggest f**king spider you've ever seen in all your days. And IT WAS ALIVE!!!! I put it on the floor and IT DRAGGED ITSELF AWAY!!! It must have been at least 2 centimetres long which doesn't seem a lot but it is when its in your mouth. How minging is that? Worst of all was the fact I couldn't react as I didn't want to cause an upset and put everyone off their food which had by now arrived. So I had to quietly freak out on my own. I should point out that I am a vegetarian. I guess this makes it a little worse - but its not like meat eaters regularly eat spiders so maybe it doesnt. Anyway later that day the contributor's gerbil ran right up my trouser leg while we were filming an interview and again I couldn't react as we were in the middle of the shoot. It didn't make it to my pants but it did its damndest. So I'm glad to be home now. I'm mainly filming in Edinburgh for the next week so all should be back to normal for a bit. Then I think I am back in Orkney the week after that. I'm very nearly Orcadian these days. J xxx

In my 26 years I had never been to the Orkney islands. Today I got back from my second trip there in a week. Sometimes I love my job. Other times I hate it. This is one of the times I like it. It was a cool trip. Had filming all day Wednesday but managed to change my return flight to make it a day later. Went out for a pint with Cameron last night and today did my touristy bit - as detailed below. I also managed to fit in a visit to the Stromness museum which features an exhibit all about Cameron which was kind of weird. It was totally worth the £2.50 admission just for the childhood photos of him and his peedie* brother Julyan. I thought my kiddie photos were bad! If you think your parents didn't dress you expecially nicely as a child, just imagine what it could have been like if they could only shop in Stromness. Got back about half six tonight and my wee cousin Gemma came over with photos for the album I am making as a surprise for my aunty Rosemary for her 50th birthday. Then took a run over to my Nana's to raid her photo pile. Looking at old photos with old people is something I recommend you do more often. Its great fun and it reminds you of your own mortality which is not necessarily a bad thing. I'm missing Keith lots but I'm trying not to think about it. So I won't even write about it. Suffice to say he is in Singapore and has just found out he has to go to Hong Kong next week instead of home to Sydney. The poor thing wont have been home in about a month. He's been away so long his electricity has been cut off. God you'd think he lives in the outback. He's only off Oxford street. Ok nighty night folks. J x * peedie = orcadian for 'wee'

top o the mornin to ye. its afternoon now though. never mind. my trip around scotland went very well. before this week the furthest north i'd been in the uk was inverness. now its stromness! we filmed first in peterhead. stayed in a nice enough hotel where the night porter freaked me out by dragging me away from the rest of the crew and offering me the keys to the hotel pool to go skinny-dipping. i passed on that little offer. then it was on to banff where we had a nice little bungalow in the grounds of a hotel. then on to thurso which - apologies miss debbie dunnett - is a dump. we stayed in a fairly nasty hotel there. then we caught a boat to the orkney islands where our show's presenter - cameron - is from. he enjoyed showing us about and we went for a really nice chinese meal that night. we sat around the table telling ghost stories. or rather everyone else told the stories and me and our production assistant barbara quietly freaked out. i managed to sleep ok though but allan the cameraman scared himself too much. the hotel we were in was the old hospital you see.... anyway it was a cool trip and the last hotel we were in back in thurso was really nice. i'm heading back to orkney on tuesday just for one night. wish it was longer. its a really cool place and i'd like some more time to explore it properly - maybe go diving among the ww2 wrecks at scapa flow. would be bloody cold though. will no doubt have some more pics for you later in the week. J x ps - i went to see spiderman2 yesterday. it was cool. spiderman still looks a bit too animated for me though. cgi is not all its cracked up to be!

Orkney is a wonderful and very friendly place. Jono xx ps - not much planned for this weekend, just sorting stuff out. Everyone knows when you are interviewing for a flatmate you can turn up some odd folk. Just take a look at the movie 'Shallow Grave' (early Ewan McGregor). I've encountered some in the past, like the guy who came round to view a room i had free but he hadn't been home from the night before. He'd pulled someone. stayed at theirs and then come round to view my flat still wearing his ruffled shirt from the night before, sweating alcohol and telling all about his adventures. That aint gonna work my friend. But tonight's effort really took the biscuit. For legal reasons I can only let out the other couple of rooms in my flat to a couple or a single person. No way round that. Tonight a lesbian couple came round to look at the flat. They seemed very nice except for the following three facts: 1. They both played the drums and intended to practise regularly - strike one. 2. They had a dog who was four feet tall - strike two. 3. THEY WEREN'T ACTUALLY A LESBIAN COUPLE THEY WERE JUST PRETENDING - strike five hundred and thirty-seven. Good God in Govan! What in the name of the wee man is that all about? That takes the crunchy biscuit it really does. But on the plus side I had been a bit weepy all night about my imminent departure and all that I'm leaving behind so the laugh we got after the pretend lesbians had left made me feel SO much better. I can't thank them enough. They aint moving into my flat but I reckon they were sent by the big man to make my life a little bit nicer this evening. Thank you ladeez! Anyway look how late it is - after 11. I have to be up at 5. I am going back to Orkney (sick of the Orkney pics yet folks?). This time I am going with the lovely Rachel whose picture you will find below. The first pics of this post at the very bottom are from a small gathering at my workmate Pauline's flat the friday before last. Jono xxx ps - hurrah! Nadia won Big Brother. She is FAB-U-LOS!!!
